intro: Waitzia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered waitzia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed and have a velvety texture. Waitzia grandiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
